abstract: "American Horror Story" had its debut on FX and earned the network's third best ratings for a series premiere behind "Justified" and "The Shield."
snippet: "American Horror Story" had its debut on FX and earned the network's third best ratings for a series premiere behind "Justified" and "The Shield."
lead_paragraph: Coming a mere 48 hours after the cancellation of "The Playboy Club," NBC announced on Thursday that another freshman entry, "Free Agents," will get the axe after only four episodes. The comedy could only muster 3.3 million total viewers on Wednesday. No replacement has been announced to occupy its 8:30 timeslot. Elsewhere, "The X Factor" transitioned nicely to the "Boot Camp" portion of its competition, roping in 11.5 million total viewers and winning the night for Fox in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic by retaining 100 percent of that demographic when compared to the 90-minute episode that aired last Thursday. CBS was once again the most-watched network with "Criminal Minds" (13.3 million viewers) leading the way.

headline.main: Viewers Not Scared to Watch 'American Horror Story'
